references.paper_title: Towards principled methods for training generative adversarial networks
references.reason: This paper provides foundational analysis of GAN training challenges and heuristics used for stabilization.
This paper introduced the Wasserstein distance for GAN training, improving stability and addressing mode collapse.
This seminal paper introduced the concept of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a fundamental model in deep generative modeling.
This paper provides the theoretical foundation for generalizing the Kolmogorov-Smirnov distance to multivariate distributions, which is crucial for KSGAN.

references.paper_title: Concentration and goodness-of-fit in higher dimensions: (Asymptotically) distribution-free methods
references.reason: This paper presents the theoretical framework for the Generalized Kolmogorov-Smirnov distance used in KSGAN, addressing the challenges of multivariate distributions.
